Blog.post: I should really write in this at night, instead of here at work. Problem is I can't find time to write at night. I'm too sleepy and am really tired of thinking. School and work will do that too you. Grr...oh well. I get to go see Ferrick tonight. That's all way exciting. Problem is I won't see Ferrick friends there and well, Lauren will be there and not that Lauren is a bad person, she's just not my favorite person to go to a Ferrick concert with. I'm supposed to go see Catie Curtis with her too, I'm almost hoping she backs out and I have to find someone to take the ticket. Perhaps I'll have a better time. No, that's a really bad way to think of things. Think of the evening like that and it will be bad. Ugh...ok well, I'm going to go find Mark now, so I can get some work done before Ellen shows up. Grrr...Ellen...

Lots going on. Been a long day at work and it's still not over. I have class tonight as well. Ugh. See 'Us' for description of work day. Um...yeah...write more later I spose. Weary me is off to pretend to work more.

Ok so I finally have a phone. That's always nice. Not necessesarily beacuse I need to call anyone, but because I'm an internet junky. Not that you didn't know that already, seeing as though I have a web journal. ;-) Concentric doesn' t have a local access number for where I am in Cleveland. I was forced to steal an AOL disk from my neighbors mailbox (it had been there for 3 days, I swear) and sign up for my 3 free months. That will take me till the end of November. Hopefully I can sign up with Juno or Netzero for the rest of November and December. God that seems so far away. Living alone really isn't all it's cracked up to be. I miss Abby, but even more than that I miss the idea that there is someone who would notice if I never came home, or never left for that matter. There's no one to talk to, no one to cook dinner with, for or for you. I can even go as far to say there's no one to be annoyed with. At least that makes life interesting. Ugh...I have what's going to become a very nasty cold. At this point it's just the runny nose, but I can feel the sore throat and the coughing coming on. Ick. I hate being sick. I think I'm going to go ahead and leave work a bit early. Only by like 15 min and you know what, I plain old don't feel good. I need to drive out to CSU though. Get my book and in general figure out where the place is and about how long it takes to get there. Should be fun. Right.
Ick...I've been neglecting this haven't I. I really shouldn't be typing this at work. I will get a phone in my new apartment by Wed. I'll catch things up then....or at least that's the plan...

Ugh...I still have one more final to go. My Circuits exam didn't go as well as I expected. I'm pretty sure that's a bad thing. But oh well, it's over now. Reno is no longer coming to visit. Not at all surprised. I've learned to not count on her to follow through on anything. At least she gave us more warning than usual. Perhaps that's a sign of improvement. I officially came out to Janice and Carolyn. I'm making Carolyn a CD as we speak, as something special for that dumb silver ball thing my mother started. Ok it's not dumb, simply corny, but that's ok. I'm heading to Cleveland tomorrow to check out an apartment that I'll be sharing a lease on. Or at least that's the plan. Hopefully it will work out. Anyway, that's what's been going down the last few days, I need to get to some studying and make a CD cover for the mix I'm making. later...

La La La, here I am again...procrastinating the writing of a paper. At least it's a different paper, eh? Ugh...one final down, 2 to go. It won't be long till the semester is over. I am very excited about that. Reno is coming up for a visit, thurs through Sat or possibly Sun. Then Sun, Abby and I are heading home, then over to Oxford to pick up Binnie and then down to Cincy to see Michelle Malone in concert, playing a solo and band set, for only 3 bucks. How incredibly exciting is that? On a less exciting note, I will be home till the 15th. I hate going home. It's always so incredibly stressful. At least it's only 3.5 days. It's Abby's birthday soon. I need to figure out what it is I'm going to get her. She messed me up by buying those, I'm sorry to say but, ugly shoes she wanted. I've got the new Catie Curtis CD...but other than that I'm completely clueless. Oh well, I'll figure it out I'm sure. Man...the paper is calling me. Since it's due at 5:30 today the earlier I get started the better. ttyl,

Hey there once again...I'm supposed to be writing a paper right now. I skipped out of going to Target with Abs, Lauren and Tom to do so. It's not going very well though. Perhaps because I signed online as soon as they left. I'm finding I miss those friends I have on the east coast. I wouldn't even mind hanging with Jen at this point. I just need to be with people who are real, people who only let you in on the amusing drama, not expecting you to deal with the heavy shit. I miss Julia's straight forward, here I am, take it or leave it personality. I miss the wisdom and girly girl persona of Lisa. I miss the craziness of Jen and Norine's odd ball comments. I miss Amanda, her openess and her new crush every other day. I miss Boston. I miss snow, I miss the freedom of living 800 miles from ones parents. I miss being the person I was out there. So free, and true. Never was I afraid of seeing someone I know and having to explain. I mean, what is there *to* explain. I'm out to most of my friends from High School. Those that are left are highly religious, or I no longer care about enough to let them in on who I am. I was thinking I might try and re-establish a friendship with Sanjida while I was in Cleveland. I know I've grown a lot since High School, and while I didn't like where she was going for a while. I think perhaps she calmed down and found a middle ground. I think it could be good. Good conversation on the ways of the world. Only problem with that, I don't know how she would feel about me being gay and I know I can't talk to her and lie about it. I can't lie about it anymore. It's just not possible. Ugh...why is life so complicated? I just have to get through next week and life will be at least a bit happier for a while. Till I figure out I hate my job. But hopefully that won't happen. I'll find some new friends to hang with, and everything will be cool. Think positive. *sigh* I best be off. . .

So there's a whole lot of stress going down right now. Finals ahead. Figuring out where I'm going to live next semester. Finding out how to register for a class @ CSU and whether the credit will even transfer. Wondering whether the job @ Keithley will be horrible. It's just mostly insane. I started this blogger to continue the expression of my ideas through written words. I have an old word document filled with 'journal' entries from high school. I remember it was always helpful to write out what I was thinking and feeling, since most of the time I would not permit myself to express them publicly. Most of my stress today comes from a test in Gender Studies and the e-mail I recently sent my professor wonding why the f*ck she gave me a D+ on a "nicely written paper". I hate confrontation and for the most part, while it felt good when I sent it, completely regret it now. I spend all kinds of time and energy worrying and speculating upon what will happen when I go to class this evening. I'm trying to ignore it and simply read the assigned pages so I will have some idea what the test will be over. Other than that I turned in a completely non-working, not even close to adhering to the assignment program in Op Sys today. I barely even tried to complete the assignment correctly. Makes me wonder if I have chosen the right major. I believe it once again comes down to the professor. I have always had trouble in classes where I don't respect the person standing in the front of the room. It's not that I'm doing bad in the class, I simply could be doing much better and therefore help offset my Circuits grade and apparently my gender studies grade as well. Ugh....no good. Op sys final on tues, (he expects us to show up for class on thurs....riiiight) then a Circuits final on Wed and Gender Studies on Thurs. I'm not sure if I have lab next friday, but it won't be anything too destressing I'm sure. Anyway, that marks the end of the semester. Something I am eternally greatful for. I'm not sure I want to be going off to work, but I sure know I don't want to go back to class. I need to contact Larry...again...and ask about start dates and if he actually did send me an official offer package since I haven't recieved anything yet. Bastard won't e-mail or call me back, neither will my future supervisor, Mark. Oh well, I have other things to worry about at this point. Like 2 papers, finals and laundry. It'll all get done and everything *will* work out for the best. Lets just hope they don't assume my start date to be August 13th. That would be *really* bad. Especially if they expect me to do any work. Sheesh...I still have another 40 min till Abby is done with class. I spose I'll go off and read my gender studies stuff...I got a lot of it done in Op Sys this morning. (Should tell you something about the respect I have for Dr. Salari eh?) I'll be back later...

Feeling overwhelmed Under pressure Out of focus Wondering what's next? Where? When? Why? Hoping for the best Praying to get by Saying, "It doesn't matter" Thinking, "Why does it not?" What should a bird do When the urge to fly dies? Where should one go When all they are living is lies? Wishing for a sunrise Willing away the pain Trying to be real Honest Free Failing miserably What should a bird do When the urge to fly dies Where should one go When all they are living is lies

So, I came to Toledo this weekend. Didn't do much other than watch TV Friday night. Although I did have a brief visit from Lauren and another from Jason. Yesterday was a long day. I went with Lauren and Jason to campus where we participated in Parents Day activites. Ok, we got free food and um...wondered around campus, spending at least an hour in the Spectrum office reading magazines. After all that excitment we heading to the Glass Bowl for the football game. Toledo 41, Northern Illinois 20. Not all the surprised as our team is actually pretty good this year. Running 4-0 with Chester Taylor looking like he might be ellegible for the Heisman. After the game, I went to Bretz's with the boys. Oh my...what an evening. I ran into Troy and surprisingly enough Tiff. Tom, Troy, Vern and I spent most of the evening hiding in a corner simply chatting. Troy fixed his wide eyes on Vern so we had the pleasure of his company most of the evening. Jason claims he has kicked Brian. Which is why he came clubbing with us. He also had himself a drink or 2. I really hope he has. It'll be good for him. He needs to be his own person and concetrate on fixing his own problems. While Brian started out good for him, it definitely didn't turn out that way. So yeah, go Jason. About 3, Tom and I had had it. We looked for Jason to take us home and when we found him he said he needed to find one more that was ready to go to fill his car. Since we could not fund that other person, Troy offered to take us...or rather Vern home. Last I knew Troy was strategically planning a way to end up in Vern's apartment. Well, that may be unfair. All I really know is he wanted to be alone with Vern so they could "talk". And he wonders where the "slut" rumors come from. Sheesh. Oh well, I had a lot of fun, dispite the absence of my Abigail. In general, I'm glad she decided to go camping. Oops...laundry is done. Best be going . . .

So let's see...what's up for today. I got up, came to work. Did some work related things and then went to a very boring co-op meeting that Nick and Joe decided not to wait for me before going to. Speaking of those two, I still haven't figured them out. Joe doesn't say much, I'm getting the vibe that he doesn't like me, nor care to talk to me. I really don't know if that's his personality, or if he actually has some sort of grudge against me. Jesus Freak Nick is amusing at times, but for the most part just really not my style. The straight guys I hang out with tend be either a: liberal or b: outgoing. He is neither. Makes for very boring conversation. Anyway, I came back from the meeting and ate lunch. Now I'm installing solaris 7 on some older than dirt Sparc's. Which takes *forever*. It's nuts man. So yeah, I had dinner with Sanjida last night. It went surprisingly well. She was completely cool w/ my gayness and was, like everyone else, not at all surprised. We didn't stay on the subject all that long so I didn't get the chance to tell her my gf is Abby. I'm not sure why I didn't bring it up right away. I guess for me easier to just come out as myself and rather than as a couple. Couple...what is that anymore? I feel so distant from my Abigail. I'm not sure which it is, the miles or the time spent apart. There's just something missing. *sigh* I don't know, I simply don't know. I spose we'll find out when I finally do see her again. Um...yeah...that's about all I know for now....later....

I slept very well last night, and uh this morning. It wasn't all that bad, but I didn't get here til about 9. I walk into my cubicle and there's a note from Mark saying that when I get there I should join him in conference room D. I'm like...ok. So I'm walking down the hall and there's a bunch of marketing bigwigs in the CR and I'm like...no way...sure enough as more of the room can be seen, there's Mark and some other engineers sitting at the other end of the table. Great. So I walk into the room, find a chair and sit down. Being like, Mark you are a bastard, you just made me look bad. Since I had no prior knowledge of the meeting, I was not aware I had to be here for a 9am meeting. Anyway way, it was a product feasibility meeting in which they kinda decide whether to move forward on a proposed project. The meeting lasted until 11:30. Ugh. So anyway, after the meeting was over, I talked to Mark about what went on yesterday and what I should do today and he apoligized for not informing me that he wanted me to be there and whatever else and now I'm eating lunch. Or perhaps pretending to still be eating lunch, but that's not really the point. Anyway, I got directions to go pick up Sanjida this evening. I'm a lot less nervous about it today. I think it's just the difference in my moods in general. I'll let you know how it goes later. Um yeah, I spose I should head off and find myself some work to do. Sounds like fun eh? eh. ttyl,

I am having an icky day. You know the ones where nothing seems to be going right, and no matter what you do, you feel bad for doing it b/c you should be doing something else? Yeah, one of those days. I've been @ work for almost 5 hours, however I have gotten next to nothing accomplished. While that's not entirely my fault (ie Dave Rose took the eqipment I need to use and Mark, nor Tony are here to answer questions to the little work I do have) I still feel all guilty about not getting anything done. I spose that's a good thing. Last co-op I got to the point where I didn't feel the slightest twang of guilt not getting anything accomplished for days. I definitly like the job, but at this point I'm kinda running out of things to do. Waiting on a phone call from Abby. After she calls I'm going to go find Dave and get his calculator from him. Then I get to pretend I know what an S-Parameter is and go about calculating them for data I don't have. Yup. Should be fun. Just about as much fun as Diff EQ tonight, oh wait....no, as fun as my dinner with Sanjida tomorrow evening. So incredibly nervous about that one. I don't believe she's seen my short hair, and really it's a bit *too* boyish for me at the moment. I now have a gay sticker on my car which she *will* see and yeah...Don't know if I can avoid coming out w/o compromising my morals, and if I do come out, what will her reaction be? I spose it can't be worse than my mother's. Still, I'm not looking forward to it. Speaking of not looking forward to things. It looks like I'm going to be spending the weekend in Toledo on my own. Abby is rather adimit about going camping. Which I don't blame her for, and I know I have to let her be her own person, but I would really like to see her this weekend. If I don't it's only one more week, but man, these past two have been so long already. Hopefully I'll be able to have some fun in Toledo. I have at least the football game to go to. Other than that I can spend time thinking, writing, doing homework, laundry. Perhaps I'll actually get to revamping my old web page. What a novel idea. Been almost a year since I've touched it. Beginning to wonder if Abby is ever going to call. I need to go talk to Dave and hang out in the lab where there are actual numbers, but who knows. I wonder if Alex is here today. I haven't seen him at all. I need to find out from him what numbers I should use to make the calculations easier. Ugh...this is absolutely no good. I need to get *something* done today. Hopefully Dave Rose will give me the VNA back so I can loop the test KTM overnight. That would be *something*, I spose. Ok well, I think I'm giving up the wait. Sheesh...I'm off to find S-parameters. Yay!

So, it's been almost a month since I last wrote. How nuts is that? All kinds of stuff going on in the world and in life. I would like to sit down and write it all out. Organize my thoughts and such. However, Mark is supposed to return any minute with help or so I'm told. I promise I'll get to this eventually. For now there's been too much for words and well, not enough drive to even turn on my computer @ home. It's been pretty insane. Of course if you're really interested in what's up, check out 'Us' that one gets updated 2 to say 5 times a day. Lots of info there. Not that the random reader even knows where it is. But my future self does, that's all that counts. La di da...I'm off...

Nothing much exciting here. I'm simply trying to kill some time at the moment. I'll think of something profound to say eventually, promise. sigh...today has been one of those days. I simply wish I could cease to exist for about 24 hrs. Just to give me a break from life. My brain's been full of all kinds of things recently and therefore I haven't been sleeping all that well. Not that this state is something new, but I had been rid of it for a few weeks. That was nice. Sleep is nice. I miss Abby...just thought I'd share... Back to work for me I spose. How fun is that? Not very...*thbbth*
I don't know...am I supposed to be writing things of general interest? Sheesh...

So I visited urlLink ephiny today, and it seems as though she appreciated my "I'm a freak e-mail" That makes me happy. I'm glad it brought her some comfort, or whatever. She seems like a cool chick and I'll probably be checking out her site every few days to see what's up. :-) Spent the weekend in Toledo. It was way fabulous to see my Abigail again so soon. I finally got to hang with Britt, Jan and David a bit. Not sure I missed much. They are, for the most part, really cool people. However, they have an air of superiority about them. They are extremely condesceding toward anyone that's not the three of them and are in general, simply imature, yet slightly intimdating. Just the fact that they are always together is a bit unerving. I don't think I'll be spending much 'social' time with them in the future. It's simply not fun. So yeah, I think the 'we need new friends' conclusion Abby and I came to this summer is still relevant. Lauren manged to get on both my nerves as well as Abby's this weekend. I don't really know what it is...her self-centered nature I spose. Dave is, well Dave and will probably simply become 'the roommate' rather than a friend. I have an odd feeling money will clutter those ties and I'm willing to bet he'll move out in May. If not, he'll have grown up a lot. Which, in theory, is what the Army did for him. Eek...I have a test to study for and a meeting @ 1. I should probably get cracking at something that's slightly more productive. uh...yeah...
Ah...it's snowing here...I don't quite know how I feel about that....

So I was supposed to discuss Lauren. Right, I kinda forgot about that. This could be a bit tough, as I don't remember all the details of what I wanted to say. I spose I should wait on that one till after the weekend, as I will be seeing her again Saturday, at least. Ugh...she is a very fabulous person...I can't stand that she lets herself be treated like crap. Sheesh...Anyway, nothing much exciting going on here. In the midst of several trades and I have come to the conclusiont that a trip to Best Buy is needed. More MD's, blank CDR's and tapes. Should be a fun trip. Probably stop on my way into Toledo this evening as I need to make tapes to mail out on Saturday. I'm not entirely excited about what I'm getting in return, but a trade is a trade, that will help set up more trades. It'll be good I'm sure, as long as I get all that I am promised. We'll see. I spose I should try to get some work done. Not that I really have any. I guess I'll go read and try and find Mark in an hour or so. We might set up a meeting to go over PR's, how boring would that be? Like I said, back to work. You should to! :-)

So I did one of those "Are you a freak or what?" kinda things today. I was bored, searching the Blogger.com database for interesting blogs. I ran across urlLink this one and it just sorta said "you know exactly what this chick is talking about" at the end of the post she listed her e-mail address, it said to me "e-mail her". So I did. She just sounded so alone, so neck sticking out, out there. Figured I'd give a "Hey, you're not really alone" kinda e-mail. I don't know...just kinda screams "Yes, Becky, you are a freak" But then again I already knew that and frankly, it doesn't bother me all that much. I try to do what it is I want to do, despite what others might think. While that's not always the best course of action, or even the action I take, I still try. It's the thought that counts right? Hmm...probably not, but whatever.
Are you out there? Can you hear this? Jimmy Olson Johnny Memphis...

Hmm...this is getting long...probably slightly boring as well. Oh well, just because I added a link to my webpage doesn't mean anyone is actually reading this. For now, it's amusing me and that's all that really matters. Uh...the archives seemed to have reappeared. That's kinda random. Don't really know what's up with that. I guess it's just as I said, random. Anyway...moving on... Sunday: Sunday morning my mother, father, Abby, Maddie and Mrs. Valley (god, I can't even type it...sheesh..I spose that issue could use it's own post, eh?) went to 'brunch' @ Friendly's. Not all that interesting. Mostly talked of Centerville High School gossip, as that school is all any of us really have in common...well, unless you count all that unmentionable stuff. (oh...I mentioned the unmentionable...even in such vague context, it's still cause for alarm. If you're my mother...) Though I spose it's a bit of a step in the right direction. A tiny baby step forward is better than standing still. I left my parents @ Friendly's and returned to the Valley's. Switched another load of laundry and then Abby and I went and got my car an oil change. It's really much happier now. Back to the Valley's finished laundry, chatted with Binnie for a bit (who had returned with car, which was the whole reason I picked her up in Oxford, but I'm not really sure if I explained that...hmm...) and then got in my car and drove 2.5 hours to Toledo. (Yes, here is where the Lauren story comes in) ..Oh wait, no it doesn't we're going to make issues with Lauren into a seperate post at a seperate time, b/c I want to finish this before I go home and frankly...I've lost the desire to think that hard. OK...basic events of the evening w/o superfluous philisophical thought: **Jason scares the shit out me, honking and screaming at me "Hey Sexy!" while I'm digging through my trunk for clothes to wear to work the next day. Chat with him breifly, apparently he's off to work, no useful or interesting information obtained from conversation. **Enter apt, Dave's not home (big surprise), call Abby and Lauren. Msg for Abby, Lauren asks if we can leave asap, she wants to stop at her parents house before going to the venue. (Yes, another Ferrick concert, get over it) **Get in car with Lauren, stop and get Wendy's (yup...again) drive to parents house, get new to me, old to them Britta Water filter thing. Drive off to venue. **Get lost, no big surprise there, Lauren calls father. Father for once knows where we are. Find venue and park. **Long line, as we are late, but the doors have opened so it moves fast. Enter room, decide we're not close enough to the stage to make standing through the show worth it, find seat at table along the side of the room. Chat till Ferrick comes on stage. "Chat" is reason entire post on Lauren and her relationship with Becca is needed. **Listen to fabulous concert (boot turned out wonderful, yay!) **Concert over, drive home, call Abby, voice mail again, leave cute message, go to sleep. Um...yeah...that's all I got. At least for now. I'm going to go back to actually working and hopefully get some stuff done. Sounds exciting eh? Not really. yeah...

OK then, Saturday: Um...got up, watched 2 episodes of ER (the one from 2 weeks ago and last weeks) Made/ate waffles, baked cookies, played with the Mini Disc recorder. (Ok, so Abby really did most of the first 2 while I played with the MD. So sue me...) Just a rather lovely, relaxing morning with Abigail. Then we drove to the Valley's, chatted with Abby's parents, started laundry, raked leaves and buried Madeliene(where the hell does the extra 'e' go?) in them. Then went to my house. Listened to my parents argue, my mother tell me I look awful and other such fun things. Went to China Cottage with my family for dinner. Michele drove my old car and we had to go around all the hills. Very cute. She's getting the whole driving thing down. Kinda amazes me that I got my temps and then one month later my license, now there's all these rules that I don't really know about, but they basically force the driver to take a lot more time before getting his license. After we returned from dinner Michele inexplicably had to have *me* give her a ride to the movie theater. In general, it allowed Abby and I to get out of the house (with no plans to come back) and Michele to get out of having a parent pick up her newest 'love' interest, namely Matt. So Abby and I play chaufer picking up Stephanie as well, throughly amused with the whole 'high schoolesque' situation. Nostalgia, pure and simple. We then returned to Abby's house, where her parents beat us at Euchure. Just as we were about to switch to playing spoons, Michele calls asking for a ride, the use of a cell phone and a list of 'legal' things to do on a Saturday night. In the end we drove them to Border's and Wal-Mart, then home. Not all that exciting, but it was worth the effort. Michele was all way cute with the boy and Stephanie is always fun. She's the one Michele brought to spend a weekend at college with Abby and I, neglecting to let her know that I was gay, that all my friends are gay and that my gf lives in the same room with me, but she was way cool about it...so whatever. It was good to spend some 'quality' time with Michele as a peer, rather than as part of a family unit. Although it was obvious that Abby and I were, 'keeping an eye on them'. I inadvertantly educated them on matters of human genitaila. Demonstrating my lack of respect for the origin of male pride. It was definitely one of those, 'Oops, did that come out of my mouth? That's what I was thinking, but not really what I meant to say' moments. Anyway, we dropped the boy off, and then stopped by my parents house to get Michele's things (apparently she's sleeping @ Steph's), dropped them off and returned to Abby's parents place to get some sleep. La di da...Sunday -> Coming Soon. :-)

urlLink Alrighty then...where was I...uh...yes. So Megan and Binnie show up and after Binnie tries on just about all of Abby's clothes we head off to Wendy's to get some dinner. (notice my trend in food for the weekend...this makes twice in one day...yum) Sitting in the restuarant...eating and talking. Megan and Binnie begin to 'argue' over who gets the most 'action' on the floor Binnie is an RA for. Two, probably 15 y/o, girls in the corner begin to laugh and mock us. Lesbians this, lesbians that. Binnie makes a rather loud and obviously directed toward them statement to the effect of "Obvioulsly *they* have a problem with that" (It worked into the coversation somehow...I don't really remember *exactly* what happened) So the chicks stand up and all get in Binnie's face or whatever. Eventually ending with the oh so brilliant remark "I wouldn't eat that chilli, I mean, I don't know you, but I wouldn't eat that." Then basically sprint out of the restuarant yelling something about lesbians and how they have to get out of here. Well, now we were rather amused and well, proud of ourselves for forcing 2 girls to leave our presence. I mean...perhaps if it had been 2 large guys things would have been different, but really, we just found the homophobia to be rather funny. We finished our meal and then headed to the parking lot, hanging out by the cars waiting for Binnie to satify her nicotine addiction. A car that had just left the parking lot, circles back around and from it one of the girls yells something like "Fuck you you stupid fags, Fuck you" Megan immediately hollers back "If you're going to insult us, at least use the correct derogatory term, bitch" We then get a choice finger, a few more fuck you's and some lesbos! Hmm...that was interesting. First of all, the pair had someone else driving for them and second, they never bothered to leave the shelter of their car. (An oh so fabulous blue urlLink Celica btw, which is why I noticed the car in the first place) A drive by shooting off of the mouth, if you will. Really rather odd and simply amusing. Which completely undermines any conceiveable goal those chicks may have been trying to obtain. Ineveitably, the four of us will turn into large deisel dykes who tried to hit on them, but whatever. After that we headed to the urlLink Southgate House for the urlLink Ferrick concert. The concert itself was fairly fabulous. It was a nice change to attend a show with Abby rather than Lauren. Not that Lauren's a bad person, but well...we'll get to that story shortly. Or perhaps not so shortly, but you know what, fuck it, I'm having fun and it's keeping me from murdering Mark for giving me an insanely tedious job. Anyway, it will be described eventually. So yeah, the show. Um...I saw Ann there, watched her get drunk and do a horrible job at bootlegging. If you don't want people to hang out around the equipment and talk and perhaps sit on it. Stay close to your equipment. Sheesh. My bootleg came out fairly well, a bit bassy but still listenable. The new MD's took care of the skipping during play back, the random stoppage of recording and the 1/2 hour TOC edits. I also gained too much information regarding Binnie and Megan's sex life. Which I didn't know existed before that evening. As far as I had been told, they were just friends. [ Mental note: How much did Binnie drink? If at all...would that have had some effect on the amount of information she was willing to share? Information came more readily out of her mouth as the evening went on...maybe? Hmmm... ]Speaking of Binnie and Megan....I really don't know what I think about that relationship. First of all, Binnie is a Senior and Megan is a Freshman. Robbing the cradle much? I mean, yes it is college and that's different from high school and age in love shouldn't matter and all that jazz, but really Binnie, you couldn't have come up with someone more mature? Or perhaps that's the point. Binnie has always started her new relationship before ending the old one. One of those, can never be alone kind of things. While I will agree with her that Liz was probably no longer good for her, I can't pretend I think Megan is a better match. She's gone perhaps from one extreme to the other. A more responsible Liz to a less responsible Megan. Megan represents college, fun, few responsibilites and the possibilty of sex w/o emotional attachment. (One could describe Miss Megan as a 'slut'...however...I'm not sure I'd go that far) As Binnie heads toward that dreaded graduation, she's realizing she's not ready for the real world and hence clinging to the past. Perhaps there was too much future with Liz, perhaps the parenting by Liz was too much a reminder of what she should be doing. I don't really know, and it's all speculation, but in general...Binnie does not act the way a senior getting ready to graduate should. There's a reason for it somewhere, probably similar to Abby's fear of being alone, but it's there and it's not going to go away until she acknowledges it's presence and does something about it. And that's what I think, at least right now. Ask me later, I'm sure it will have changed. Well then...I'm going to leave Saturday for a later post...must return to work...at least for a little while. :-)

Hmm....looks like it's been a few days since I touched this. Not all that surprised seeing as though I didn't touch a computer for more than 15 min all weekend. It was a welcome break from what I do just about 24 hours a day. I'm going to be blind and have horrid arthritis in my wrists when I get old. Oh well, so is everyone else I know. The PC generation...in more ways than one. Hmm...basic break down of the past few days. Thursday: [ See last journal entry for early in the days events. ] I drove for four hours from Cleveland to Cincy. That was much fun. I had several revelations I was supposed to take time to write in here, but at this point in time, I have no idea what they were...so we're going to skip that portion. I arrived at Abby's. It's always such a surreal experience to see her after however many weeks it's been. Almost like it's not happening...almost like I don't even know her. The feeling quickly fades and I return to the bliss of holding my Abigail in my arms, but it's there nonetheless. We watched urlLink Will and Grace and planned the following days events, talking to my parents, Binnie and Abby's mom (even though I've been told to call her Janeth...I still can't get it out. I'm such a dork.) on the phone. Then went to bed...taping urlLink ER . Friday: Abby got up way fucking early and went to work. I just kinda layed there half concious like. Eventually I got up and headed to urlLink Oxford to pick up Binnie and apparently Megan as well. While wasn't aware she was tagging along, I was rather grateful for another person to converse with. For whatever reason I never feel all that comfortable around Berina. Kind of a 'what to say' delima as we have absolutely nothing in common other than her family. She can be amusing enough, but I would never hang out with *just* her. Too weird I guess. As I found out last evening, her parents are rather worried about her and issues of a pair of ambercrombie jeans (with the security tag still on them) and a DVD player that's supposedly Liz's. I don't know exactly what I think about that. I know I don't put stealing past her, but I like to think that's she a more responsible person than that. Then again when we told her to meet us @ 5:30, we did so knowing full well she wouldn't show till at least 6. Anyway, the drive was rather uneventful save some amusing conversation involving Megan's intelligence as well as driving ability. We arrived at the urlLink High School and I left them in the art room to find Isbell for lunch. After some searching I found her and we headed to Wendy's drive through. We returned and ate in the teachers lounge surrounded by Neidhard yelling at someone on the phone, some sub and Mrs. Ransbottom. Isbell is one of those lady's that thinks she's way cooler than she is. She is always sure to ask me about Abby but when it comes to disscussion on real gay issues she fumbles. I'm don't doubt she's ok with it, but she has much less information about such subjects than she lets on. My opinions of her have shifted since high school, I think that has a bit to do with my being 'an adult'. All in all, Centerville is the perfect place for her...it's all about social status and the way you appear to others. After some gossip and failed philisophical discussion, I headed back to the Art room to meet Michele. I felt bad, I was a little late, but she got over it, got her lunch and Stephanie and returned to the art room office where I watched the two of them and Valley eat their lunch, disscussing random topics of boys, teachers and school work. Very amusing half hour or so. Spent the rest of the school day hanging out with Valley. Loading a kiln and talking of Berina and Abigail, life goals, gossip and other random points of interest. Hmm...I wonder how many times I've used the word random. Oh well, at least it seems I've broke the habit of apparently...I was beginning to fear turning into Jen. Anyway, after school we drove to Jennifer's (Maddie's babysitter) and picked up Madeleine and a friend (Amanda?) and drove them to an art class. Returned to the Valley household, talked bit. Geoffery came home. Talked some more. I left about 4:30 stopped by my house to grab somethings, then drove back to Abby's apt. Apparently I woke her up from a nap. We gathered things together for the evening's activities and waited for Binnie and Megan to show. .....going to have to finish this later...damn work....sheesh. ;-)

Ok, so the archives dissappeared again. What is up with that? Sheesh. I'm at work, bored out of my gourd, wishing it were 5pm or better yet 9pm so I could be in the arms of my Abby rather than here. Ick. Work normally isn't bad, but today, today is just horrible. Mostly to do with my attitude, which I spose it what made Compaq so horrible as well. But the attitude comes from somewhere. In this case it's lack of work and my evening plans to be in Cincy as opposed to talking to Justin and doing all that tedious coverage shit. I don't know whatever. I'm just hoping for a fabulous weekend *away* from Cleveland. Not that Cleveland is all that bad a place. If I knew people here, it probably wouldn't be bad at all. No worse than say Toledo. I spose I could go and join Lesbian Avengers or something...but really...I'm not *that* desperate for people to hang out with. I enjoy the time alone, time to think etc. but at the same time I crave social contact. More importantly, social contact in which I can be totally myself. However, I spose it would be good if I knew what that was. I have the idea of who I would be and what I would do, and then I have the things I actually do and say. Very different concepts. For example, I'm in the elevator in Rhodes Tower on my way down from DiffEQ class with some random guy. This guy looks at me in the...ok are you male or female kinda way. Apparently he decided to take the 'safe' approach and asked me a question. (The voice will nine times out of ten give gender away.) I politely answered, *really* wanting to remove my self from such a tiny space with a random older (50's?) man. He then proceeds to say "That hair cut *actually* looks good on you". I looked at him and wanted to say something like "That fake hair *actually* makes you look younger" instead I said, "uh...thanks". So the question is, should I have insulted him back? Or simply assume he doesn't realize what he's saying and politely remove myself from the situation? Which person should I/do I want to be? In my head I've always wanted to be the insulter...the one that says what's on her mind and fuck what other people think. However that is not *always* how I act. I don't know...good questions to be thinking about in life. I spose there's good and bad qualities to each side and in general I just hang out in the middle, hopfully taking the best of both worlds. Not sure I like the idea of mediocrity, but I spose it means I'm not inferior. Whatever...too much thinking...my brain is jumbled into some form of incomprehensible mess that some how continues to function. Kinda like when your room is a complete and total disater area, yet you know where everything is...well...except that other shoe you need so you can leave for school. Yeah...exactly. Ha...wow...off to get some lunch. . .ttyl,

Ugh...so *very* sleepy. I met Lauren at the Beachland Ballroom last night for a Ferrick concert. While I had tons of fun, the show wasn't over til just before midnight. Didn't hang around all that long, but by the time I got home and settled down enough to actually fall asleep, it was way past 1am. Problem with that being I had to be at work this morning by 7. Why that early you ask? Well, the plan is to work my 40 hours in 4 days, rather than five and seeing as though I slept through my alarm yesterday, I have plenty of time to make up between now and Thursday. I spose it doesn't matter all *that* much. Just money I don't get. Whatever. I'm looking forward to seeing my Abby and well, another 2 Ferrick shows. Speaking of which, my MD was acting out again last night, as well as this morning when I was trying to play back what I recorded. I missed at least 3 songs, including Mercy, Hello Dad and most of Then So It Is and on the songs you do hear, bass drum drowns out most of whatever you're supposed to be hearing. I think I need to figure out how to either a: turn the bass down or b: simply turn the recording volume down. Either way, I'm not sure how to do that. I'll get the book out tonight and play with it. Hopefully I can work some magic on my PC and the boot while incomplete, will sound half-way decent. I also need to upload photos and work on my newly updated w/o much content web page. I'm really rather excited about this batch of photos. I think I got a few more 'keepers' than usual. So yeah, I should probably get back to that whole work thing. Even though I really don't have all that much to do. Later gators. :-)

So, I'm pretty sure I am officially bored. Even the prospect of updating my webpage doesn't sound appealing. I figured I should take some time to try and write something. Perhaps that will help kill some time, at the very least. I've done absolutely nothing this weekend. I had 2 goals: 1. Grocery shopping and 2. buy new mini discs. I only completed the first of those two goals. Not that I didn't try. I drove out to K-mart, but they didn't have any. How incredibly sad is that? What's worse is the closest Best Buy is like 15 miles away. How can one live *that* far away from a Best Buy? I mean, come on. So yeah, I guess it looks like I'm going to have to record with the ones I have at the Ferrick concert tomorrow night. I'm rather depressed about that. I really want to know if that damn MD just doesn't like 80 min maxell's or if it's truely defective. That and in theory the recording will ineveitably miss a lot of the concert. So like is there a spell check on this thing? I spose not...don't see one. You're just going to have to deal with my typo's and incorrigable spelling skills. Case in point, eh? Sheesh. Anyway, other points of interest for the weekend. Madeliene. Whose name I think I'm spelling correctly, but I never really know. She is such an amazing child. What's more amazing is it seems she likes me. Childern don't normally like me. She was asking all kinds of, 'When do I get to see you' type questions. I spose it simply means there's a connection there. I spose dating her sister for the last 2.5 years has something to do with that one. I don't know...just kinda hit me. The Valley's really are my family. What pisses me off is it seems they are more family than my own. I'm sure my parents don't enjoy that fact much either. My parents, especially my mom, really have no idea who I am. I've gotten better about showing my father my true self as opposed to the "I'm straight...really I am", self. Michele is pretty cool in general. She told me I sounded like a grown up the other day. I told her, "I pay rent, electric bills, phone bills and work 40 hours a week. I am a grown up darling." Somehow I want to save her from the terrors of High School. However, being heterosexual and somewhat popular, I'm sure she doesn't have the same kinds of problems I had. Still, I want her to be true to herself, and not one of those fake people. Basically to adopt all the principles I have, which in theory will make her happy. Which it won't, cause she needs to do what works for her and obviously I'm not quite so happy myself, but well, you know what I mean. The idea of 'parenting' someone to be like you. Which I guess is where my mother runs into problems. I'm not like her. Man, I wish I could get my thoughts and feelings to conincide. Although, I spose then I would have no emotion. That would probably suck. So never mind, scratch above wish. However something along those lines would be nice. I'll let you know when I figure out exactly what that is. I had other thoughts...but got distracted and no longer remember what they were. Oh well, this post seems to contain a sufficient amount of randomness anyway. Till next time. . .

Ha ha...I am a goddess! Links to the archives are now posted to the left of this message. Yay go me. :-) You have to understand I've been trying to figure out what was wrong with those things for the last 2 weeks or so. Nuts.

In the midst of updating my webpage. It's kinda fun. I've added a link to this journal. I figure, what the hell eh? I changed my template and for what ever reason I still can't get the archives pages to work. I don't know what's up with that. Talking to Jen on the computer. She always seems to get hit with the worst...all at the same time. I spose eventually she'll get her break in life...but dude...that sucks. Been a slow weekend so far. Staying in Cleveland alone is never all that much fun. However, I get things like webpage updates done. :-) So yeah...I'm off to write some more html. yay.

So, in general, I wish that I were more motivated to write. (and that when I am....blogger doesn't loose my posts.) However, when I am motivated to write, I tend to be depressed. I don't really want to be depressed....however I want to be able to, with ease, place words on a paper that make sense. I don't ever want to return to the pain of my middle school, or high school years. However, I wish the prowess with which could compose poetry, short stories and such would return to me. That's really about all I've been thinking about lately. That and how to redo my web page, what to make for dinner and trying to plan this weekends activites. My life is uber exciting right now. Really. It is. This semester is much better than say my first semester in college, or even my second. But I believe the 3 between then and now to be a bit more positive. Gaining friends who really know who I am, working and living in MA and then a semester with fewer friends, but more time with my Abigail. Coming out to just about every one of my friends from High School, knowing the rest are inevitably aware of my status as a gay woman. The last year or so has been good to me. I hope the following years are just as kind. Looking at my schedule for next semester I can't help but wonder how that will change. Knowing that Spring is the semester for drama with in Spectrum and wondering where Abby and I will be in the summer. Just a bunch of question marks really. I spose there's no need to worry about them now. Just pondering...when I should be working. What's new eh? It's not my fault really. If Mark would give me some work to do I would do it. He just simply hasn't. Speaking of Mark...he's probably returned from his meeting. I'm off to engage in the second have of the game "Hide and then go Seak out the Supervisor". Should be fun...

It's snowing today. Not a horrible storm or anyting, but just enough to let you know winter is on it's way. Lots of stuff floating through my head today. Not much of it is comprehensible, but from what I can gather it's a general discontentment with life. Not that life is bad, it's just, distressing. For example, class last night actually got hard. Doesn't it know it's not supposed to get complicated? Sheesh...it also can't help that the holiday season is upon us. I usually enjoy this time of year, however, this time, I wouldn't quite use the word enjoy. I'm aprehensive, not sure about the whole visiting with family thing. For T-day, I'll be at my parents house. From Wed evening till sometime Sunday. It's going to be a *long* five days. At least we're not driving up to Mich. I don't like the idea of having to pretend to be straight and conservative. Nor do I enjoy my grandfather telling me I "look too butch, put a dress on and use less hair spray". Hrumph, I also have to find a B-day present for my sister, and figure out Christmas presents for just about everyone. Ugh, giving isn't supposed to be stressful. Oh well, I best get back to work now. Enjoy your day...

Ugh. This is going to be a long day. I feel horrible bad and I don't like the work I'm supposed to be doing and *thbbth*. I just want to go home and go to sleep. However, that is not an option. I do however get to go home, pack for Toledo and then drive there. That should be amusing. Really. Talking to Lauren on the computer. She's, as my grandfather would say, 'on my shit list'. Basically, she can do absolutely nothing right, until something occurs to remove her from said list. (Usually lots of time not seeing/talking to her is needed) In general, I feel my blood boil and my eyes shooting daggers whenever she says *anything*. She was added to 'the shit list' after our trip to Inkster last weekend due to, well, general annoyance and for whatever reason, has yet to be taken off. We're supposed to go to the football game this weekend. I really don't think I want to go, but Abby does. Although I believe she also sees the pitfalls of attending a football game with Lauren *and* her parents. Apparently, Jason's parents are attending as well. That could be um...interesting. Hmm...best be going now I spose. Work. Ick.

Sounds fun, but it's never quite what one expects. We aren't the same people we were in High School. Planning to see Manda as well. I'm really excited about that one. Haven't been able to actually chat with her recently. She never seems to be around when I'm online. Not much to be done about that I spose. Hmm...seems class is starting...I must abandon you for now...bye :-)

it's been four years since that day when the news fell from the sky you took "until we meet again" and turned it to "goodbye" and I hope that you won't rest in peace because that would bore you right to tears you always made the richest feast of the dangers and the fears it was almost fine, you were almost mine it was you and me and love made three on a broken white line well that night was long, there was one more song and then we were on our way driving slow, no place to go and nothing more to say and the rain came down around that car like we were underneath the sea in the back seat, almost drowning, holding on to me it was almost fine, you were almost mine and from town to town we chased it down on a broken white line looking in your eyes was just like staring at the sun always thought that I'd go blind or end up all undone and in the end I turned my face away from where you shone so bright now I wake in all this darkness crying for a little of your light it's been four years and now I find I've been living all this time I built myself a little world of rhythm and of rhyme but sometimes I take your picture and I turn it to the wall because you are still a cliff and baby I still know how to fall it was almost fine, you were almost mine but day by day you slipped away down that broken white line it was you and me and love made three ~Kris Delmhorst~ Broken White Line
Watching stupid sitcoms, contemplating life. Feeling the need to be productive. Haven't found much of anything to fulfill said need. Hrumph...off to reorganize my CDs or something...
Why do heterosexuals always ask us stupid questions? Read urlLink this ...they really do sound stupid don't they?

Hmmm...back again. I spose I should be sleeping at the moment. Or at least trying to. Must get up for work in the morning. I'm not really dreading work. Mostly just the thought of that empty bed. It's almost easier *not* to see my Abby. At least what I'm missing is not quite as fresh in my mind. I can't imagine what life would be like without her. 4 hours seems trivial compared to forever...still, I miss her. I miss us.

Another weekend gone...seems they come and go so fast. Nothing all that special this time around. Friday we (Abby, Lauren and I)attended a Michelle Malone concert at the skanky dyke bar in Inkster. (Stiletto's) This place was classic. Walk in, old school Melissa Etheridge playing over the sound system. Those of us underage were given glow necklaces to wear, rather than the usual marked up hands. That was pretty cool...for the first 5 min. Then you realize you have to wear this damn thing the rest of the night. That and *everyone* knows you're under 21, which I guess is the point. The waiter (yes he was male...interesting) was asking us if we wanted a pop or something. Surprising phrasing being in Michigan and all, 'pop', hee hee. The place has two rooms, one with a dance floor (I assume, not that I actually went in there...probably had pool tables and darts too...not a Lesbian bar w/o those) and one with a stage, complete with catwalk. Seems they have drag shows...as well as strippers on certain nights of the week. Sucky sound system, drunk off their ass 'chatters' and people traipsing back and forth from the oil wrestling to the restroom. (Uni-sex restroom no less) In general, it sucked...but not because Michelle sucked...she was great, you simply could barely hear her over the stories of who fucked who, the pumping bass and screaming from the next room. Oh well, such is life. Saturday was spent sleeping, playing nintendo, watching movies and eating ice cream. Today we cleaned, went to Target, played more Nintendo and ate more ice cream. A fabulously relaxing weekend, spent with a fabulous girl. Dave was conveniently in Cleveland this weekend...leaving the apartment to just Abby and I. Very nice. Something I wish I could do more often. Back to work tomorrow. No class though. Yay for Veteran's day. Off to unpack and watch the X-files...

Guess who I received an e-mail from. Yup. Exactly. Apparently she does want to 'chat about life'. I replied, although not really knowing what to say. Wondering what exactly will come from this new found communication. I've closed that portion of my life. At least I like to think that I have. I'm not sure I want to revisit it. Then again, I spose I can use this as a test. Tug a bit at the stitches used to close those old wounds. It's about time I find out how developed my sewing skills are.

So...speaking of random people reading my journal...I'm at work today, being incredibly bored. Perhaps not in so many words, but my basic job description for most of today was 'surf the internet'. So I willingly complied and caught up on my mightybigtv.com reviews and read a bunch of message boards and whatever else. I run a search on bootlegs and surf on into a rather familiar site. I headed back out to the main page to check out what was up with a 'onetime high school friend' as her 11.04.01 update put it. From what I can gather she found my newly linked to the world journal, just as my father had. Now I spose I'm simply assuming she's speaking of me, and that could probably be labeled rather arrogant of me, but I don't know...just seemed to fit. So I spose if you're reading this again... urlLink drop me a line ...we'll chat about life or something.

Hmm...haven't written in a while, eh? It's not really that I don't have anything to say, it's just well, I don't really have anything to say. I've been given information that may be changing my view on this whole online journal thing. That information being my father read it. I spose that's not quite as bad as my mother...but still, a bit nerve racking. I realize that I can't let the fact that others read this, change the information I put here. That would completely moot the point of writing. This is an outlet for me. The fact that someone, somewhere might be reading it helps me to feel that I've gotten something off my chest. However, it's a bit scary to think that the subject of such writing is the one reading it. Ah...not much more time to type about my fears now. The journal is here, and it's staying...at least for now.

I'm just about ready to leave work for the day...ok I'm more than ready to leave work, it's just I need to be here for another 20 min or so to get my hours in. Unless I'm really into something, I'm usually worthless about this time of day. Which is why I'm writing here instead of coding those damn KTM's. I guess they really aren't *that* bad, but they get extremely tedious. Hopefully I can finish them up tomorrow. Abby may or may not be visiting me in Cleveland this weekend. I hate that she tends to get me all excited about something, then tells me 'oh it was nothing' or something. Not that she does these things on purpose. It's her whole roller coaster ride of emotions. I still can't figure out how her moods change so quickly. I want to ask her to just come see me. At the same time, I want to tell her to stay there. Probably the same conflict of emotions/logic she's dealing with. I don't know. I guess I mostly want to know if I should bother cleaning this evening. The plan was to do it this weekend, but if she's coming...I should really do it tonight. Whatever, it'll work out. Apparently Michele made the JV basketball team. Yay for her. Makes me wonder if I should of stuck with bball. Then again when I think back, I hated every second of playing with the high school team. I dispised most of my teammates, hated the coach and almost wanted to be constantly sitting on the bench. Basketball wasn't like soccer, I had never figured it out. Playing for Lupia we always had set plays, I knew those plays and I could handle it. Soccer was a larger space, more one on one, less confusion, fans further away. I think in the end I put too much pressure on myself, and perhaps my Dad didn't help much, that it got to the point where nothing I did was good enough. I felt like my every move was scrutinized, critized. Hmmm...just odd I spose. Soccer is better. That's all there is to that. Time to go...thinking a lot...perhaps will write more later...bye

So, I just had a wonderfully delicious conversation with Amanda. That child is simply amazing to me. So different, yet so exactly the same. She is what I would be...had I the guts to do so. Waiting for Abs to call...I signed off while typing this...my conversation with Amanda left me connected past our usual phone call time of 9pm. I've already talked to her once this evening...I'm not all that worried. I've realized a several things in the past month or so... The matriarch~ I need to talk to my mother. In theory to help start our healing process. I so badly want to connect with her. I really hope that I can. I just have to remember that her insults and put downs have nothing to do with me. They are all about her. They serve a purpose for her and pin pointing that purpose, will help to resolve these issues. If I can just have a chance to talk with her. To really talk...perhaps things can work out for the better... The patriarch~ This weekend, Abigail accompanied my father to Cleveland to help pack up most of my stuff. I tried to stay 'stoic' and 'straight' but it simply didn't happen. It had only been a week since I had seen her, but still I couldn't be *that* close and not express my feelings. Dad seemed to take it in stride. We acted mostly as if we were around her parents...it was nice...no it was fabulous to be that honest in front of my father and it was wonderful to know that he was at the very least, trying not to show any discomfort he might have, and the most, not even having any discomfort. The sibling~ I wonder how the parents are dealing with Michele's boy. I almost envy the relationship she carries with them. Hell, it can't be much fun from her point of view, but all that making fun and teasing, is something I never had. I hope she knows how significant it is. I'd like to think that she never had a problem with the whole 'gay' thing. She was barely surprised when I told and for the most part has been nothing but supportive since. To me. However, I have a feeling it's still a bit of a sore spot with her. Something she doesn't want to admit, so as not to be seen as some sort of outsider to her peers. I'm not sure she's explained everything to this Matt boy yet. I hope that she does, and I hope that she realizes that, in the end, someone who can't accept me, is simply not worthy of her heart. This whole gay thing~ I'm realizing just how large a part of ones life their sexuality is and that if they don't match those around them, it's hard to connect on any other level. The relationship I have with my gay friends is entirely different than that of my straight friends. Sexuality is rarely a topic amongst those who 'family'. Sure, there's boys talking about boyfriends and girls about girlfriends, but these are simply taken in stride. I am simply me and I am part of the whole. Around straight friends the air is slightly heavier and a large sign is placed over my head. 'DYKE' I am gay. I am constantly reminded of this and sometimes almost feel I have to prove that I really am a lesbian. Somehow the conversation is always steered back to sexuality and no matter where I was before, I'm pointed to as the outsider. It's strange really, and something I plan to study further over winter break. I'll let you know if I come up with anything... 10pm~ Haven't heard from Abigail yet...perhaps I should start to worry...nah...if she was alone in Cincy, I would, but as she's in Dayton this evening, there are plenty of other things and people to distract her. Still, I wonder if I'm even heading in the right direction. I think what scares me the most is I can't imagine myself going anywhere else. Nothing other than a boring engineering job comes to mind when I think of my future. My only joy in life comes from a stupid television program...and my Abigail. She made me these cute little cards. One for each day between now and the next time I'll get to see her. She is just so amazing to me. As you can tell I've been thinking about the future lately. I must admit that every scenario I've ever thought of involves her. I don't even care to *think* about life with out her. Too bad we can't get our act together enough so that we even live in the same city. I love her with all my being. I just wish I could find a way to express it adequately. I wonder if she feels as loved and taken care of as I do. Perhaps the best way to find out would be to ask...however, I've found that trial runs are always a good idea. God, what on earth did I do to deserve her? If I may reflect on the past for a bit...we were 'friends' and then I kissed her, and I told her I loved her. I don't even remember making the decision that changed our lives forever. Hell, I didn't think about any of it. I never even considered the possibility of her following in others footsteps. Leaving me, after the admission of my true feelings. A day or two later, she wrote me a note. I don't remember the specifics, however the gist was...I'm ready to jump. I never thought about the status of our relationship, or even that there was a decision to be made. I had jumped a long time ago, and never bother looked back, or down for that matter. So far in life, I've never had a problem with commitment, or loyalty. However, Abby's talk of commitment ceremonies and babies leaves me, well...typically male. Those ideas have *never* been figured into my equation for life. I've never wanted to have children, then again, I always thought I would be the one to do the 'having'. I never wanted to have a wedding, I don?t like the idea of that much attention focused on me. I think that explains a lot about me right there. I don't think I can say I've ever put my full heart and soul into *anything*, cause then I might get noticed. While at the same time, I'm writing this in an online journal. The wonders never cease...ugh...too much thought for one evening. Time for sleep...

This is really frustrating. I'm not sure I like this whole Abby having an online portal to her soul. Not that I think she shouldn't express herself in whatever ways she wants, but that I have to make that connection with her through the blasted blog. That I have to read about these life altering battles going on in her head and insightful conversations with her mother, rather than having her tell me about them. Now the fact that this is the second time I've been told of warnings from her mother well after the fact has me slightly worried. This cycle of 'Abby seems happy, Abby talks to mom, Abby's seems unhappy, withdraws from me until some major explosion occurs where she tells me she's been thinking of breaking up with me' sucks. The stupid and seemingly simple solution to this would be: don't let Abby talk to her mother. However, it is so not my place to tell her that. Besides, I respect her mother's opinions. I think she's a fabulous person and if she observed us 24/7 she would hit the nail on the head. But she doesn't. She only sees us together in the unusually stressed environment of being home. Now, I haven't lived as long, or through as many things as Janeth has and in theory, I haven't known Abby as long as she has, but I really don't think Abby is truly the person her mother thinks she is. Therefore, the motherly outlook is skewed with, once again, the corrupt data thing. What really gets me, is that I'm telling this to a computer and not to Abby. I just keep telling myself that if I was actually planning on seeing her, I would talk with her then, but since I'm not and I have an extreme hatred for phones, here I am. *sigh* So, the next question on my mind, why is it that we only truly question our relationship when we're living apart? There are several possibilities that I see, some obvious (we see how much better life is without the other), some not so obvious (it's harder to face a break-up when you're truly together and therefore you don't want to think about it, where as while on co-op it seems as though you may have already split). Either way, I'm not sure anything I'm coming up with is truly the answer for us. Probably a large and confusing conglomeration of several factors. I spose then that I take my previous statement back, not enough brain power today to truly have that question on my mind. Moving on. What else in bouncing around in my head this afternoon...not a whole lot apparently, well once Abby issues are set aside anyway. I spose I should take that as a hint to get my ass back to work. Mark...oh Mark...wherefore art thou? Ugh.

My Abigail gots herself a urlLink blog . She's used it to type out all of her emotions from our interactions this weekend. So I guess I'll use mine to do the same for myself. It's amazing how someone can ponder something that will directly effect someone else for seemingly a long time with out bothering to discuss said things with said person. I realize I'm guilty of it myself, but it's still a shock when the love of your life says "I'm not ready to let go" as if she's been thinking about doing so for a while. Not that I didn't feel her pulling away. But it's only now that I recognize it as that. The biggest issue in our relationship, as well as the entire human race, is communication. She doesn't want to, or can't, or I don't understand what she's telling me she's feeling, so I place what I think she's feeling in to fill in the missing variables and vice versa. This, corruption of data, causes faults later on when actions are taken upon the analysis of the corrupt data. All and all, there is no fix for this bug. The system's design won't allow it. I'm knee deep in some 'workaround' patches though. (Yes, I realized I just placed human interaction into a computer analogy) I love Abby. It's a fact that can't be questioned. Regardless of what happens in the future, I always will. The question that Abigail has raised though, "Is that enough?" is a good one. We've got the love, but do we have the rest of the necessities needed to sustain us. Are we healthy? Or are we slowly starving ourselves to a point where we will no longer recognize ourselves let alone each other. How do we know which path we are on? And then once we do, decide if its time to make an exit. From my point of view: I think perhaps I've taken 'us' for granted, at least a little bit. Forgotten, or desperately wanted and tried to forget, that while life, in general, is work, life with someone else is inconceivably harder. Over time we've created an auto-pilot of sorts, she does this, I do that. She says that, I say this. It was inevitable that we would grow out of it and now that we have we need to remember how to adjust, re-learn where and when to roll with the punches, to give slack, or to yank hard. It takes time, as do all good things in life. I need to find the motivation to work at life. Instead of just watching it go by. I need to dig down deep below the depression and apathy to find me again. Find out what I really want and need. Rather than relying on the auto-pilot, parts of which were created so long ago, it's going to be next to impossible to unravel it from my existence.

So I've been listening to Melissa Ferrick's "Listen Hard" a lot recently. Perhaps that's because it's one of the few CDs I actually have with me in Cleveland, but that's not really the point. When I first listened to the album, I almost hated it. It was so 'pop-y' and the songs that I had heard before and *loved* just weren't the same on the disc and the title, I *hated* the title. It was just horrible. What am I going to do now that woman who's music speaks to my soul the most, is speaking a new language? I guess I just kind of forgot about the album and rarely listened to it, until recently. Now, the album just seems, well, perfect. (as long as you skip 'back in love', I still don't like that song) The title, at first seems to come out of nowhere. Huh? After a few spins, you actually start to learn the lyrics and find the one that seems to have spawned the title in 'You': "Who else would listen? Would listen so hard?". (I try really hard not to read the lyrics until I've memorized the song. This has led to some interesting interprations of what's actually be said, but still, I think you get so much more out of a song by analyzing what you hear, not what you read.) Anyway, so now there's at least a superfical connection from the album to the title. Now, this is Ferrick's first studio album to be recorded in an actual studio since 'Everything I Need'. It's evident immediatly that a *lot* more money was spent on this album than for 'Freedom' or 'Valentine Heartache'. So, initially, it just sounds produced, which in general, is bad. The production on this album has allowed every song to be layered with sound in a way that hides the layers and makes one sound. Well, that's what production is for, right? Maybe, but here, if you 'listen hard' (and wear head phones so you're more aware of the specifc placement of sounds in space) you can hear each layer, and every time you listen to a song, you find a new one. A violin here, organ there, back-up vocals you never noticed before. To me, this is what makes it a great album. Yes, it's 'pop-y', yes there are some *very* superfical (corny?) lyrics, but the music, the music is simply amazing. The disc changes every time you listen to it. This is why I've listened to it 3 times through today, and probably will again tomorrow.

Although I hear Sum of All Fears is a bad movie, Mark lost his keys and python is an evil language. ;-) Manda is currently experiencing some relationship issues, ie, the one she was in no longer exists. I don't envy her at all. There are times that I wonder whether or not Abby and I will last, whether she's the one that right for me and all that jazz, but I always come back to the fact that she's what's right *now*. The future will always be uncertain and there's really no point in worrying about it. Being proactive against pain and suffering in the future will only help you to miss what's going on in the present. Similarly, being proactive about pain and suffering in the present will, for the most part, only cause more pain in the furture. My conclusion, don't be proactive. Fix what's wrong, not what could be wrong. Worry about what is, not what could be and most of all, be honest about what pain you're feeling currently. K...I think that's all of my philosophical thoughts for the day. Kinda sad isn't it? *sigh* Perl, here I come!
