So, this morning I received a *very*, shall we say, disturbing forward from someone I graduated with. Not that I hadn't read it before or that I was even surprised by it's content. Anything beginning with, "Billy Graham's daughter..." has to be something that will shake my very existence. In fact, Abby got the same forward from her Great Uncle. Although, I spose it's not quite as horrifying to receive such a thing from an old man. It's a piece of religious bullshit aimed at scaring people into being christian. Be like me, think like me, act like me and no harm will come to you. I desperately want to e-mail this person and give her a taste of what I believe. However, seeing as though I'm well aware of her religious beliefs and her reaction when questioned about them I didn't feel it would be appropriate to e-mail her. She, just like everyone else, is entitled to her beliefs and has every right to express them. However, I have that same right, so I'm venting here. Let's start with the first paragraph of Anne Graham's response to the 9/11 terrorism: Anne gave an extremely profound and insightful response. She said, "I believe God is deeply saddened by this, just as we are, but for years we've been telling God to get out of our schools, to get out of our government, and to get out of our lives. And being the gentleman He is, I believe He has calmly backed out. How can we expect God to give us His blessing and His protection if we demand that He leave us alone?" First of all, god is not a gentleman nor is god male. God is not someone we can talk to, we didn't ask him to do anything. American was founded on the principle of religious freedom. So no, your god, miss Graham, is not in our schools, government, or my life; nor is anyone else's. At least it shouldn't be, but we don't need to get into all the details of how christian our society is. In light of recent events -- terrorists' attacks, school shootings, etc., I think it started when Madeleine Murray O'Hare complained that she didn't want prayer in our schools, and we said OK. (She was murdered and her body was recently found.) Ok, can we say low blow? Lets find some poor women who was murdered and *happened* to think differently than us and use her as an example to deter people from 'heathanism". [insert eye roll here] Next you'll blame 9/11 on feminists, abortion doctors and gays...oh wait, you already did that. Then Dr. Benjamin Spock said that we shouldn't spank our children when they misbehave because their personalities would be warped and we might damage their self-esteem. (Dr. Spock's son committed suicide). We said that an expert should know what he's talking about. And we said OK . So know you're advocating the beating of small children? OK, so I spose that isn't really fair, but seriously, why are you taking another man's pain and using it to further your agenda? This Dr. Spock is just as human as you and did you ever think, that maybe he came to this conclusion *because* he spanked his child and that child later committed suicide? Of course not, there is only one side to every story. Then someone said that teachers and principals had better not discipline our children when they misbehave. The school administrators said that no faculty member in a school should touch a student when they misbehave because they didn't want any bad publicity, and they surely didn't want to be sued. (There's a difference between disciplining, and touching, beating, smacking, humiliating, kicking, etc.). But we said OK. Apparently capital punishment is the only form of discipline, and if you're an adult, you can do anything you please to a child or teenager, because obviously you know better. The line must be drawn somewhere and the line that has been drawn seems to minimize the gray area. Then someone said, let's let our daughters have abortions if they want, and they won't even have to tell their parents. And we said OK. Anti-abortion and pro-death penalty. I will never understand that contradiction on a moral level. It's a woman's choice, damn it. Bodies are not something to own. Someone's parents nor should the government be allowed to tell anyone what to do with their own body. Then some school board member said, since boys will be boys and they're going to do it anyway, let's give our sons all the condoms they want so they can have all the fun they want, and we won't have to tell their parents that they got them at school. And we said OK. Right, cause if you're not getting any, then of course your teenage son can't get any. This is not the dark ages and sex is not our enemy. Teaching children to deal with sex responsibly is the only way to keep teen pregnancy and STDs to a minimum. Humans want to have sex for a reason. It's instinct. It's natural. And it feels good. Then some of our top elected officials said that it doesn't matter what we do in private as long as we do our jobs. Agreeing with them, we said it doesn't matter to us what anyone, including the President, does in private as long as we have a job and the economy is good. I don't ask what you do in private, why should I ask what the President does in private? As long as it's not illegal, I don't give a shit. It's their life, not mine. One person cannot represent the ideals and morals of every person in this nation. No matter what the president does, it will offend someone. That doesn't make you special. I mean really, you don't bring up George W's DUI do you? Then someone said let's print magazines with pictures of nude women and call it wholesome, down-to-earth appreciation for the beauty of the female body. And we said OK. Ok, so I might agree with you on this one: pornography is not wholesome and down-to-earth. However, it's not wrong. Yes, it may be demeaning to women, but so is the Bible. And then someone else took that appreciation a step further and published pictures of nude children and then further again by making them available on the Internet. And we said OK, they're entitled to free speech. First, I believe it is illegal to place pictures of nude children on the internet. Second, free speech can be a bitch when you don't agree with what's being said. It was never used to defend child pornography and have it succeed in convincing the masses. Hello! It's illegal! Third, just for the record someone who enjoys pornography is not necessarily a pedophile. Just as 'a homosexual' is rarely ever a pedophile and not all christians are close minded. Then the entertainment industry said, let's make TV shows and movies that promote profanity, violence, and illicit sex. Let's record music that encourages rape, drugs, murder, suicide, and satanic themes. And we said that it's just entertainment, it has no adverse effect, nobody takes it seriously anyway, so go right ahead. The entertainment industry makes movies with such things in them because they sell. G rated movies only make money for Disney and the Olson twins. You're all about capitalism right? The music industry...once again, capitalism. They sell what will make the money. Which I guess is your point. We as a people shouldn't want to see these things, but we do. It's called curiosity. It's instinct. Without it, religion never would have been created in the first place. Now we're asking ourselves why our children have no consciences, why they don't know right from wrong, and why it doesn't bother them to kill strangers, their classmates, and even themselves. Interesting your use of the world "our". Their children, but not *your* children, right? Your children were raised with christian values and would never *ever* beat the shit out of the smallest boy in class and call him a fag. They wouldn't commit suicide because they can't bare to dissapoint you by living life as a sinful gay. They wouldn't light Muslim Mosks on fire, lynch a black man, refuse service to someone of a different ethnic background or simply tell a racist joke. Probably, if we thought about it long and hard enough, we could figure it out. I think it has a great deal to do with "We reap what we sow." Uh...exactly. Hate and intolerance will not pave the path to Utopia. Nor will stripping away the diversity of this nation. It's funny how simple it is for people to trash God and then wonder why the world's going to hell. It's funny how we always believe what the newspapers say, but always question what the Bible says, or dismiss it as not being pertinent in this modern, space age world. It's funny how you can send jokes through e-mail and they spread like wildfire, but when you start sending messages regarding God, people think twice about sharing, and delete them before anyone sees them. It's funny how lewd, crude, vulgar and obscene articles pass freely through cyberspace, but public discussion of God is suppressed in the school and the workplace and that's supposed to be all right with us. I question the newspaper, I question the Bible, the Koran, Budda, Allah, God, my god, my government, myself. That's my job, my duty to myself as a citizen of a nation and human being in a civilized society. You have questioned the laws and have served your duty. I applaud you for that, I just don't agree with your answers. I wonder why the world isn't a happy place to be, but I don't believe god has anything to do with it. Use your God and your lack of obedience to him as your scapegoat, I'm looking for answers to the worlds problems, all the while trying not to place blame. There is no point in trying to place blame when there's no one to place it on. Like you, I believe God should be discussed in public places, amongst people who *want* to join the discussion. I also believe that other religions and belief systems should be discussed in public, but I don't believe that any idea, including my own, should be forced upon any one else. So these are my ideas, responses to someone else's ideas. I cower here rather than facing those whom I disagree with. However, I have learned that people rarely change their minds or learn something new if they have no intention of doing so. I try to learn from those around me, be open to what they have to say, and then form my own opinion. My biggest criticism for those following organized religion to the "T" is their lack of thought. Spoon feeding the masses will only result in upheaval, look at history, you'll see it. We need to find a way to be united, but not the same. Adhering to Christian ways in not the answer, Nationalism is not the answer, and bombing innocent people is certainly not the answer. Perhaps Ferrick has it right, "Acceptance is the answer". Or, perhaps there just isn't an answer.

The good news is that questions you are asking will answer themselves over time, the bad news is that it may longer than you want. Anyway, I hope relationships and jobs and life all works out like your hopes and dreams want it to! He is way cute. I think I'll keep him too. :-) Thanks, Dad!

So, I was watching urlLink Boston Public last night (Note: This isn't a *normal* occurance, but since when is my life on co-op 'normal'?) and the urlLink episode got me thinking a bit. One of the issues covered dealt with race and the use of the 'n-word' by the African American culture and how it's ultimately different when used by a white person *despite* the context in which it is used. I'm not sure how I feel about the whole 'reclaiming' of words. On the one hand, I use hateful words in a 'loving' context all the time, 'dyke' being top on that list. On the other, is that a good thing? Does 'dyke' have the same overall connotation of hate that 'nigger' does. No. Should we place words such as these all under the same umbrella of 'don't go there' despite the level of hate behind them? Yes. Because, ultimately I feel the same horrible things when I'm called a 'dyke' as some else would were they called a 'nigger' or 'fag'. In the end, I don't care what you call me. The hatred one may feel for me is based on them, not me. However, mental rationalization only soothes the initial pain. So would using the word more help to desensitize the word? Ease that initial pain? Perhaps, for an individual, but not on the whole. So what can help the whole cope with the hate? Beats me. Personally, I think that I should use certain words a lot less. Mostly, because even if the person it's directed at is 'family' they may not place the same 'okness' on words that I do. And in the end, there's always people who will over hear and take things out of the all important 'context'. Spreading hate is not something I think that I do, but in the end, I'm just as human as the next guy and perhaps even less aware of the damage I can cause.

Why is it that people want others to be the same as them? And if they are not the same, they are inherently bad people? I just don't understand. People are different, and they should be, but they are all still human. A person who has the right to just as much repsect as you do.

Sometimes I dislike myself Although, who doesn't right? Everyone has moments in time when they think "I'm scum". Moments when we wish we were different in some way. Better than who we are. Thing is, these changes can never *really* take place. You are who you are and that's that. When one can accept that, in theory, they will no longer wish they weren't themselves. The trick is to actually believe that. I think that people can change. Change is a basic part of life. Things happen that cause other things to happen and with this chain reaction, something will inevitably be changed forever. But I don't think people can choose to change. Change happens *to* them. Which leaves me in conumdrum. What should I do when I find myself saying "I'm scum!". I can't say, "I don't like that, I'm going to change it" because I don't believe people can choose to change. Therefore, I gain no comfort from such words. So I'm left with nothing. I'm hanging out, waiting for change to find me. I think the ego is a weapon of mass destruction. Used by people to tear eachother down. If it were just me, I would be god to myself. Perfect in every way. I would be happy. Perhaps. As I stand now, surrounded by other egos, I feel inferior. I have yet to find what is it that *I feel* distinguishes me from everyone else. I saw a bumper sticker the other day "Remember you're unique. Just like everyone else". I find truth in that. In the end, when you boil it all down, we're all the same. We're all of one...something or other. Connected by six degrees of seperation, the earth, the universe. There's something out there that defines me. I'm still looking for it, I think I will be for all enternity. Sometimes I dislike myself. Sometimes I wish had done something different. Said this instead of that. My worst nightmares consist of embarassment and humilliation. I fear I will say something stupid. That people won't like me. I've somehow left myself to the mercy of others. I have to remember not to let others control me. To live for myself, rather than for the praise of others. I'm worth the air I breathe, and most importantly, so is everyone else.

Intra-personal relationships are...well, interesting So is it intra or inter? Whatever...the point is, I've been thinking about how it is people interact. What is it that causes us to like some people and dislike others? What causes me to be drawn to some people and yet desperately want to get away from others. How is it that those feelings can reverse themselves in a matter of seconds? Is it emotional and therefore simply chemical? Personality clashes? Completely based on past experience? What about the whole first impression thing? *sigh* I think this thought process is bigger than myself. Probably shouldn't attempt it at 11:30. Then again, that's probably why I'm still wide awake.

with this life, what will i do, how will i define myself... will i ever be satisfied with my surroundings, my ability to love, to accept praise, and receive criticism eloquently. i want to always leave a room with dignity. always searching, expecting more, always wanting my stomach to drop, with every kiss, every encounter, to be in each moment completely, without regret, without an agenda, looking up, looking forward, pulling at myself to get real, get better, show up, let go and hold on. i must try to remember that; endings don't exist -m. ferrick

Late Night TV Rots the Brain Have you ever thought that maybe people are watching *you* on tv? That once a week, someone, somewhere, tunes in to laugh and cry with you? Maybe you have your own show, or perhaps you're just a supporting character in someone elses. Maybe you're simply an extra; Girl #1, Boy #35. Have you ever thought that maybe pepople aren't watching you on tv? That your program is *so* boring that it should have been cancelled years ago? Maybe you don't make for a loveable character. Maybe people don't love to hate you, they just hate you. Have you ever thought about that? What kind of tv show your life would make? No? Perhaps you should, it could change your life.

Life, in it's most basic sense There's not much to say at this point in time. However, I felt the need to type *something*. Not sure why, but it's there. I am suitably happy with life at the moment. Sure, there are bits of drama and stress weaved in between the fibers of my happiness, but I don't think I'd have it any other way...much more interesting, not to mention the sweeter taste of the good things in life. I've been thinking recently, about the person I was in high school, about what life for me was like then. How, every once in a while, the person I was then still finds her way to the surface of who I am now. I can't say I'm entirely different, but there is enough of a difference to allow me to deal with my emotion in a much healthier fashion than she ever did. To me this is the key to happiness, knowing when to dwell on an emotion, when to deal with it and move on, quickly, and most importantly, when to ignore it, completely, for the time being anyway. At the very least, its the main difference I see between her and me. I am, for the most part, no longer a pack rat of feelings. I actually deal with emotion, instead of ignoring it, I can relate to others for reasons other than to simply seek their acknowledgement of my existence and the biggest achievement? I have grown to the point where I can say that I am happy, and not be lying about it.

The second, "Feedback Control Systems" won't be cake, but it's most basic sense is a subject I actually enjoy. The course is being taught by a professor that a. I'm not scared of and b. teaches to my learning style. The third course, "Communcation Systems" is based off the same subject as the previous course. The professor, however, is one I've never had before. He's a short, balding (with a lovely comb-over), slighly hyper-active, Korean who, while his english is good, seems to forget at least one syllable when pronoucing multisyllabic words. I don't think it will be impossible to understand him, but it is certainly going to take some time. I like his teaching philosophy...it should be good, provided I can learn to follow him. The last two courses are "Real-Time Embedded Systems" taught by the most fabulously boring Dr. Stuart (of "Electric Energy Conversion" fame) and "Digital Design" taught by a prof whom I've never had before. Embedded systems may get the axe this semester...as I've learned it will be taught in the fall by a professor whose reputation is much less devilish. I don't know...we'll see how things look @ 4:15.

A Simple Act of Kindness This morning, as I was preparing to leave for class, I heard a car, stuck in the snow, desperately trying to get out. I watched the blue geo for several minutes, as the tires spun. Eventually, the owner got out and placed his car mats under the tires in an attempt to extricate the little blue geo. No go. He's sitting in his car seemingly wondering what to do next when a beat up chevy pulls up next to his car. The owner of the chevy rolls down the window speaks, rolls the window back up and pulls his car to the side of the road, his intent clear. The man in the geo gets out and places his floor mats back in his car, exchanges a few words with the chevy owner and returns to the driver seat. With a push on the back of the geo, and rev of the engine, the car is free from the piles of snow. The driver waves to the man behind his car and drives off. The owner of the chevy, waves back and returns to his car, starts it and drives off.

I've spent a lot of time over the last few days simply writing. Trying to express what I'm feeling, what I'm not feeling. An attempt to keep myself moving, afloat in the river of life. Most of what has come out has been crap, which only seems to make things worse. I'm currently living in a sphere of apathy. Any emotion or action that would force me to reach out side of that sphere has been impossible. One should not despair though, the space I'm confined to is relatively large and rather familiar. I just need time. I always need time. Time to force the barriers outward, slowly, but surely. Time to write, rest, reflect. Time to complete the rebooting process. I'll be up and running in no time. Promise.
There's so much to learn about. So much to read, think and converse about. Sometimes I wonder if I will ever learn everything I want to know in life.

So, I'm supposed to be writing an essay for a scholarship at the moment. It's not going all that well. I thought perhaps some typing here might help get those creative juices flowing. Ha. I've always found it hard to write "I deserve insert noun here , please give it to me instead of all the other better qualified people" essays. I hate how arrogant they sound. The ability to sell oneself (or anything really), is simply something I don't have. Either you want it, or you don't. Nothing I say should change your mind. Then again, I have to assume that the 'buyer' has done their research and *knows* what they want. Which I suppose is where the whole 'selling' thing comes in. *sigh* Off to sell myself to a scholarship commitee...

Writing is Therapy So, when I get bored in class, I write. Usually nothing all that exciting, just random things that I'm thinking/feeling. When I finish a page, I fold it up and stick it in my pocket. Then, when I get home at night, I place the paper on my dresser. Periodically, I pull out the sheets of paper and read them. I did that this morning, here's some of what I found: her eyes slip past my defenses, penetrating my soul, sifting through its contents with ease. i can feel her, running over the scars, touching my pain. she tries, desperately, to heal the old wounds, to shed light upon my darkest corners. the troops are coming i say, youd better run. she looks at me, with certainty, a sparkle in her eye. i'm not afraid, she whispers, i'm not afraid. ---------- Sometimes, I find human beings trivial Sometimes, I find them offensive, appalling disgusting, Other times, I find them interesting, An infinite wealth of information. Sometimes, I find myself trivial, insignificant, meaningless Most of the time I find myself below the bar. The rest of the time, there is no bar. Sometimes, I offend myself So grotesque am I, I cant even look Cant bring myself to witness the hideous essence that is me Other time, I like myself so much, It dissolves my fear. Allows for actions I will most certainly regret. At times, I find human nature fascinating. Most of the time, I find it disappointing. Sometimes, I wish I were anything but what I am Alas, I am me, and me, I will continue to be. -------- All I have to say isGood Riddens to Bad Rubbish. See you in my next life. Where inevitably, I will have moved on to a higher plane of existence. Youll be left here, to learn your lesson. No one likes a sore loser, but you cant do anything without making enemies. Gain some respect for you fellow man. Learn to love yourself with out the narcissism you currently wear to hide the chip on your shoulder, the hole in your soul. Learn from your mistakesthats all I ask. --------- I feel the need to write. I need to express something, only I have no idea what. I need to feel intense emotions, only I cant muster up anything more than general apathy. I feel stuffed in a bottle, unable to stretch, breathe in fresh air. I want to get out, I *need* to get out, but I cant move. People talk to me through the glass, I can mostly make out what theyre saying, but its all muffled, lacking any inflection, emotion. They dont seem to notice my bottle.

Me? What Me? Sometimes I wish I could be a fly on the wall of someone else's brain. Not for the rest of my life or anything, but just for a day here or there. Able to tap into every thought and feeling, living not me in their lives, but as them, as an observer within them. Quite literally placing myself in their shoes. Learning how others react to things, how they live their lives. The ultimate study of human beings and how they react to the world around them. I think this need to be someone else, to live without the work involved in creating your own existance, observing someone else's. I think it's the cause of the creation of celebrities and reality tv. You focus your energy on others to allow yourself to ignore you. I've been doing this a lot lately. Ignoring me, focusing on my 'obsessions' so I can forget that I exist...that somewhere inside of me I'm screaming to get my own attention. It's like I'm living in some sort of fog. It's soft and warm, protects me from feelings (good and bad) and makes non-superficial thought impossible. As a consequence, I haven't been *living* life. It's an odd feeling. It's not depression, at least not in a form I've experienced before. I'm happy, I have a decient appetite. On the surface everything is fine...but I don't feel connected...connected to my friends, my family, to school, to society...to myself. It's fine, I'm fine...but I don't think I want to be just 'fine'.

*sigh* I seem to not be able to find the time (and/or inspiration) to post here on a regular basis. I've written several things during class though. (I know not the best use of tuition, but wow...so bored) I'll type a few of them (read: the shorter ones) out for you: I don't hate my relatives, but I can't really say I like many of them all that much. Perhaps it's better to say I don't really understand them. For instance, yesterday my Aunt sent a mass e-mail to all her friends and relatives thanking them for attending her daughter's wedding shower. (Note: I didn't go, yet I got the e-mail anyway) She's all gushing and stuff for a paragraph or so and the starts a new paragraph (which turns out to be longer than the first) along the lines of: "We are missing two white handled spoons, if have them please return them to us" What the? I wanted to e-mail her back and be like "I didn't go to the shower, but I teleported the spoons from you to piss you off. If you'd like to see them again, please send me $1000 in ransom and I'll return them unharmed. Thanks." I realized the other day that my sister and I are a lot more alike than we would appear to be on the surface. The way we react to adversity, how we deal with the need to succeed, our parents, the roles we play in social environment. Sure, she's all about boys, socializing, clothes, make-up, singing, acting, being the center of attention and well, I'm not. But we're still cut from the same cloth and somehow that's oddly reassuring. I understand that sometimes you just have to be pissed off. Go on a rant of some sort. Throw things, cuss, stomp your feet a bit...but sometimes does not equal all the time, and all the time, makes you just not so fun to be around. Oh, so I'm supposed to understand this eh? I supposed to remember things from a class I took a year ago that, while I earned myself a solid B+, was mostly due to memorization and pure luck. Riiiiight...this is going to be a fun semester.
Yup...you guessed it. I don't believe I'm ever going to get this damn thing done. *sigh*

Yeah...not programming again. The funny part is...I'm procrastinating the same project. Yay for extended deadlines. So while yes, it's been a while since I've stopped by...there's really not all that much to catch you up on. All I know at the moment is I am anything but tired, I don't want to write a lab report and I don't understand my Power Electronics homework. Abby's laying on the couch...pretending she's watching football. She's not of course...she's mostly just sleeping, but it's rather important not to tell her that. At least not until she's ready to be 'sleeping'. She's rather cute...waking up every once in a while exclaiming "The Colts scored!", or "Another penalty?"...it's almost like she's been watching the whole time. Then again, it's probable she'd say the same things were she actually watching the whole game...sometimes football isn't all that exciting. You can tell I'm not exactly all here at the moment...I just had to check the spelling on 'probable' cause it *so* did not look right, still doesn't. That and I'm being wordy...I always get pensive and wordy when I'm so tired, I'm not. Sometimes I wish life were like a soap opera. High highs and low lows. Everyone is beautiful, everyone knows where everyone else stands. I love that somehow everyone has loads of money, while no one really seems to go to work. That people get to say all the things they're thinking. Then again...no one is really happy in a soap opera and if you are, no one wants to hear about it. Then I begin to think that perhaps they reflect real life a bit more than most people believe. If I lived in a soap opera, I'd be the one they pull out every once in a while to move some random story along. Important in a re-occuring character sort of way...if I were in a soap opera, I'd at least know what to feel when. In the real world, I have no idea.

it's just gone. how could something so all encompasing, so essential, just be gone? i don't understand, i can't explain it, to you, to me. there's just nothing, nothing to hold on to, nothing to seek, to follow, to lead. just, nothing. an empty shell, surrounding the edges of my being. i remember your smile, your skin, the feel, the scent, the taste. the blue of your eyes, the warmth of your soul. i remember, but i do not know. i crawl into bed, and curl into your heat. the steady rhythm of your breath, the beating of your heart, calms me. soothes the jagged edges, fills the void. and then, i know.

So I'm writing to you from Abigail's new (slightly frustrating) laptop and the comfort of my couch. It's kinda fun not to have pain shooting through my right arm and lower back. (I am in desperate need of a new computer chair that will allow for less painful computer time) Honors convocation was last night. We had an interesting mix of family members. Abby's parents, my parents, Paula, Tricia, and the every lovely Jim, Beth and Robin (er...Rene...whatever dude) Slightly stressful, though we did have a facinating conversation with Tricia and Paula. Who knew they'd get along. ;) All and all, I'm feeling better about life. Not that I'm no longer stressed or anything helpful like that...but I have a better sense of things and that, well, that they matter. I've been floating along in life the past few weeks, not really caring what happens or placing any real attachment to what and who is part of my everyday existence. It's hard to explain really. It's depression, but not quite. Certainly I've been in much deeper in life...so I hesitate to actually label what I'm experiencing. In the end...know the cloud is lifting.
argh....blogger is annoying....that and I think I need to redo my site...it's annoying that I can't open the sucker with netscape. I should fix that...someday.

So, I wrote a blog entry yesterday during class...or at least what I thought I was going to type up and post as a blog entry, but now, since I've written it. I don't feel the need to share it. For me, it's mostly about the actual writing...that and re-reading entries several months from now. So yeah, I did a lot of writing yesterday (all during class...it's much less boring that way). I wrote letters to some of my cousins, an e-mail to my Aunt...and at the time, I thought they were all fabulous...just what I needed, what I thought they needed to hear. But now...none of it seems significant. I can't bring myself to type them up/mail them off. I'm afraid of what they'll think of them. This isn't some random blog entry that while I must assume there could be someone reading it, I by no means need to see these people face to face at a later point in time. I don't have to endure an agonizing wait for a response. I don't have to face the possibility of rejection. In the end I suppose I'm just a coward...but I'm pretty damn sure I couldn't handle a negative response.
Maybe I don't really belong here. Maybe I should have been an english major. Maybe I should have followed a dream. Maybe I would have, had I had one.
I can't bring myself to do anything else...so do you really think you're going to get a decent blog update? Nah...didn't think so.

So, because I'm in procrastination mode, and feel the need to mouth off a bit I'm going to do something I told myself I wouldn't...subject you to my soap opera obsession. I'm going to preface this with the fact that it's not quite kosher for *any* of the message boards I read, but I felt I needed to get it out of my system. So... [rant] All I've got for you guys is one big "Whatever, Dudes". Neither group can claim to be above reproach. One side claims this while at the same time asserting they are better, while the other side simply has no apologies for the way it approaches a fictional world. In my opinion, it comes down to the fact that one group is made up of people who love the show and worship the ground it walks on, while the other is made up of people who love the show because they can pick it to pieces or because they want more out of mainstream media in regards to lesbian representations than coming out stories and hand holding and feel their fandom can make a difference. While I must admit to being part of the latter, I do understand blind love (*cough*Olga*cough*), I just can't get behind a storyline I don't like based on it. Each side is so fixated on their own point of view, they interpret the same sentence in a different way. Bammer's interpret snark as hate and Liancalite's interpret hope as delusion. People are drawn to one side or the other based on the type of person they are, not which character they would most like to see Bianca end up with. Therefore, the type of peace you're looking for will never be made. Live with it dudes. [/rant] K...better now. Btw, my new favorite band? urlLink The Waifs

AAAAARRGGGGHHHH! Today (or I guess it technically yesterday now) the President (and I use that term loosely) announced his endorsement of a constitutional amendment to ban gay marriage. Which is something that already isn't legal (unless you're in San Francisco) but that Bush feels threatened enough by to create a seperate class of citizens and deny them rights. Whatever one thinks of same-sex marriage, either morally or politically, no person who cares about the US constitution should support such an unecessary, unusually anti-democratic, and overly broad departure from the Nation's traditions and history. Never before have we amended the Constitution to restrict the ability of the democratic process to expand individual rights. This is no time to start. Please take this into consideration when voting in Novemeber and more importantly, if you feel as I do, that this amendment is simply crap used by a President to shield what really matters and aide in his re-election, let the government know. Write letters, send e-mails, or simply pass your opinion on to others. Spread the word that this amendment isn't only about whether or not God tells you it's ok to be gay. It's also about disgusting politics, legalizing discrimination, and desecrating our nation's most precious asset: the Constitution.

I was thinking that, even though life sucks lately (or perhaps because it does), I should write here more often. Yeah, I know, I need to stop getting those...but this one is actually a good show. (then again, so *was* ER...) A British spy series called Spooks (shown here on A&E and BBC America as MI-5). Basically, it is Alias, only more episodic in nature, more polictical and with more gadgets and less guns and violence. I've come to think of it as a cross between Alias and The West Wing. Not that I actually watch Alias, but I've seen an ep or two. I love Spooks because it pokes fun at Americans. I love it because it's smart, because every character is overflowing with flaws and because they never tell you which is the right side of an argument. Basically, what the West Wing used to be, only with legends, lock picking and bugging. It doesn't hurt that Olga is leaving AMC to join this show, now does it? Too bad I have to wait till fall for the new epiodes...and even then, they'll be hacked to bits to fit US censors and commercials. Ah well, that's what BitTorrent is for. :) In other exciting TV news: They're encoring Season 1 of Nip/Tuck on FX. ST:DS9 reruns begin April 5th on Spike TV. I couldn't sleep last night...so...I stayed up and caught a movie on Showtime. It wasn't great but it was good in that it was a 'lesbian movie' that wasn't bad. I have my complaints about it, as I do *everything* I watch, but I recommend you watch Bobbie's Girl because it's a movie with lesbians that isn't about being a lesbian. The fact that there were two women 'together' was just that, a fact. It had been dealt with and accepted at some point in the past and we're left where most people are in life, simply flawed characters who are dealing with what life throws at them as best as they can. A het couple could have been @ the center of the story and very little would have changed. I like that. I *crave* that. My life is as normal and fucked up as anyone else's. My whole existence isn't dependent on my sexuality and how other's react to it. It's nice to see a filmmaker who gets that. Of course, it's on Showtime...I may have to rethink not keeping it once my free month is up. In other news...I miss Abby. But I guess that's not much in the way of 'news'.

I feel kinda odd typing about work at work. Mostly because I actually like it. It's easy to bitch about things out in the open. It's harder when you don't want to get fired. The basics: I'm working for Johnson Controls in Holland, MI. I work in the Electronics department of the Automotive Interiors section as a Software Test Engineer. It's exactly what I wanted to be doing when I was looking for a job. It's why I took the job that would have me move to Holland of all places. That and I liked the manager. It's very important to like your boss. At least it is for me. I know there's more rolling around in my brain just waiting to get out. However, they keep bumping into the programming thoughts and those seem to be winning. Not that that's a bad thing. I don't think I can really call it programming. I mean it is, but it's more scripting than programming and really, the system is annoying as hell. Oh well, at least it's stuff I can do. That's always happy. I've got the script I'm working on written, I just have to figure out if the tests are failing because my script is wrong, or because there's a bug in the software. Seeing as though I know of at least one, and all the issues I'm having seem to be related...I don't think it's me. But, I have to be sure. And I'm a long way from that. On a not quite related note, the best thing about working here, is that I'm on a Windows machine instead of Unix and while, in general, I like Unix better as an OS, on Windows, I can play music and not eat batteries with a discman. It's nice. "And the middle is a little like wide open space and the time in between the tides." ~EC
So...Life is good. Not perfect. But pretty damned close. Just so you know.

I went to a Melissa Etheridge concert this weekend. Events such as this are good, not only from a musical standpoint, but also from the people watching angle. Sometimes I wonder where all the lesbians came from, seeing as though I don't see them on a normal basis. On another note, it's always nice when het couples seem out of place. In general, fun was had by all. Especially the belligerent (most likely drunk *and* high) woman who stood in front of me the whole time. I'm still on the Ferrick list, even though my, shall we say, awe, for her is no where near the heights it's been in the past, and was linked to an urlLink article reviewing her latest album. Now, The Other Side is far from my favorite of her albums, and there are some things the author mentions that I agree with, but I have some advice for her: Next time you want to give a bad review to album by a musician whom you hold a personal grudge against, don't make it so damn obvious. Oh and, review the *album*. That was the point wasn't it? For the most part, an artist only has to impress me with one CD and then I'll pretty much buy everything that person will ever (or has ever) put out. Suddenly finding myself a fan for life. Therefore, when trying out a new artist, it's very important that I buy the *right* album. It's why I kinda like Ani, but I'm not an Ani fan. Why I recognize that Dave Matthews is a hella cool guy, but I only own 1 of his discs. An artist has to have one of three factors: good guitar (usually acoustic), amazing lyrics, or a great voice. Examples: Ferrick->Guitar, Edie Carey->Lyrics, Jonatha Brooke->Voice/Lyrics, Patty Griffin->Guitar/Voice/Lyrics. Like anyone else, I have my own definitions of such things. For instance, MLE is one of the few artists that has stuck on my playlist since middle school and I realized why the other day. It's not the vaguely (or explicitly...I mean really what straight girl is into thighs?) gay lyrics that speak to me, it's her god damned sexy voice. I would buy an album of this woman singing me her grocery list and listen to it constantly. I think that's why rhyming 'change-ya' with 'Pennsylvania' doesn't really bother me. *shrug* My point? I don't think I have one really...except that that's what I was thinking about this morning while entering requirements and listening to mp3s. So...there you go. Don't blame me, you're the one still reading. BTW, thanks for that...now leave a comment. ;)

Blogger got a face lift, so I figured my Blog should get a face lift. It's so much easier now that you don't have to write your own template. It's all pretty and new and no more than 3 clicks worth of work. Part of me thinks it's cheating and sheep-like to use a template...the other part thinks that sometimes, it's just easier to cheat and really, it's not like this kind of cheating is hurting anyone. Other than perhaps myself, but I don't think I'm going to go be a web designer anytime soon, so....yeah. I'm looking at an Abbyless weekend, followed by an Abbyless week. I was initially kind of excited by this prospect, as I've sort of, kinda had my fill of people (think extended family, for an extended weekend) and I haven't had much quality time with the PC recently. But really, I was wrong. I think this is what I want: just me and a computer with high speed internet and cable tv but in the end, I am so totally *wrong*. So what do I want? What do I really, really want? I want to be annoyed by the fact that Abby wants me to pay attention to her when I'm trying to get something done. I want to eat popcorn and drink orange juice with her while watching some horribly bad movie/tv show. I want a new couch, so I can cuddle with her without breaking one of us. I want to break one of us while trying to cuddle on my horribly bad couch. I want a cat. I want a cat that likes Abby better than me cause any cat of mine should and, no doubt, would. I want her to beg me to go on walks with her and to watch her read her dumb romance novels. I want to pretend something she reads to me from them is actually funny and for her to do the same when I read something to her. I want to eat peach and raspberry sorbet: one spoon, two mouths. Most of all, I just want her. Here, with me. Forever.
Sometimes it seems like there can't possibly be anything after the current moment you're experiencing. Or maybe that's just me.

Murphy's law dictates that when a need to blog arises, I have nothing to blog and that when I have something in my head to blog, I have no access to the blog. It's wrong I tell you. Simply wrong. I'm getting better at filtering what's on my mind and saying it, rather than a: simply saying it, or b: keeping silent. At least I think I am. I really have no way of gaging such things, but I feel good about my 'progress' today, so, we're just going to go with it. Speaking of progress and Murphy's law. I've gotten Jack done today because everything, and I mean everything, that could possibly go wrong or interrupt me from the tasks I wanted to get done today, has. (I also seem to have lost the abitily to write a sentence that is, you know, gramatically correct. Punctuation (other than the comma and the parentheses) is my mortal enemy. Or so it seems. However, I don't believe that is actually relevent to my horrible, terrible, no good, very bad day.) So...wait, where was I? Right, bad day, nothing done, wanting to rip Jan-Harm's throat out. What? I told you he wasn't dead...yet. Maybe this afternoon will allow testing to actually continue...however, judging by the number of meetings (and brain cells in JH's head) I'm not holding my breath.
I'm continually amazed by some people's inabilty to follow instructions. It seems things just don't connect...ever. Let me just say, I haven't killed him. Yet.

It's going to be one of those days. I can feel it. I suppose I can take solace in the fact that it mostly likely can't be worse than Friday. Few days are worse than last Friday...perhaps made worse, simply beacuse it was a Friday. Days such that are tolerable, almost expected on Mondays, but not Fridays. I'm behind, once again, so you have no idea that Michele spend the last week with Abby and I. She flew home yesterday. It was good to spend some time with her. I am, however, looking forward to getting back to a 'normal' existance.

Once again with the 'I suck'. This is totally inappropriate and totally mean. However, I couldn't not save it *somewhere*. You know you're Jan-Harm when... Your voicemail greeting message is so long, you feel it's necessary to remind people they're listening to a message. Blowing your nose requires an above average intake of carbohydrates. The new box of tissues you brought in that morning is gone by 10am. You think whining is an appropriate way to ask for help. You create annoying nicknames for your co-workers. It's important for your yogurt to be well shook and that not a single drop be wasted. You use words and phrases like 'jeepers', 'on the farm' and 'that's retarded'. When communicating that you understand, you find it necessary to say 'sure' twice. Since sometimes people look like they don't believe you. You answer questions by repeating random words within a co-workers statement. You spend vaulable work hours hanging out by the vending machines or in the bathroom. Filling out your time card is an all day affair. And....I haven't come up with the zinger that goes at the end of these lists...so, this will just have to do for now. Perhaps I'll add to it later...
Wow...I totally missed my own blogging anniversay. I suck. Here's to the 3 years past and the many years (months? weeks?) to come!

I really have to stop blogging at work....though I guess that will have start tomorrow. Since, well, you know. Usually I don't have time to think, let alone put thoughts down on virtual paper. So in a way, his is a happy time. In the end however, I think I'd rather be busy. A busy Becky is a happy Becky. A bit of a stress-monkey perhaps, but happy nonetheless. You know what else makes for a very happy Becky? JH is taking a week long vacation starting Monday. Woo! No more nose blowing, no more asinine questions, no more eye rolling or huffing or licking the top of the yogurt container or him calling me 'Becks'. For that week anyway....so *very* exciting. Ok, back to the grind. Counting how many time JH blows his nose is hard work...
